# Configuration of the hardware (AS and I/O)

# 6.6 Configuration of the I/O devices

# 6.6.1 ET 200M as DP slave (H system and standard AS)

Introduction

The following describes the configuration of an ET 200M station as a typical DP slave.

Note

You can find an exact step-by-step description of the configuration of an ET 200M station in the "SIMATIC Process Control System PCS 7 Engineering System" (https://support.industry.siemens.com/cs/ww/en/view/109746533) manual.

Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)

Configuration Manual, 03/2018, A5E43228900-AA

# 6.6 Configuration of the I/O devices

# Procedure

1. Open the HW Config catalog (PCS 7 profile) and select the appropriate IM 153-2HF from the PROFIBUS DP/ET 200M folder.
2. Enter the DP address of the PROFIBUS DP slave in the DP slave properties. You can also select the subnet for the DP slave (here, PROFIBUS (0)). With an H system, the system automatically establishes the connection to the redundant subnet PROFIBUS (1).

Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)

Configuration Manual, 03/2018, A5E43228900-AA

125

# 6.6 Configuration of the I/O devices

1. For high-precision time stamping, select the "Time-of-day synchronization" option in the properties of the ET 200M station and set the synchronization interval to 10.00 s.
2. The "Replace modules during operation" option must be activated within the operating parameters where the ET 200 station is set up with an active backplane bus. For the connection to a redundant PROFIBUS, this option is preset and is grayed out because the active backplane bus is mandatory in this case.

# 6.6.2 ET 200SP HA as PROFINET device

Introduction

The following describes the configuration of a redundant ET 200SP HA on the PROFINET fieldbus.

Note

You can find an exact step-by-step description of the configuration of an ET 200SP HA station in the "Configuration of the ET 200SP HA in PCS 7 based on different configuration examples" application example.

Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)

Configuration Manual, 03/2018, A5E43228900-AA

# 6.6 Configuration of the I/O devices

# Procedure

1. Open the catalog (PCS 7 profile) in HW Config, and select IM 155-6 PN HA Red from the PROFINET IO / I/O / ET 200SP HA folder.

Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)

Configuration Manual, 03/2018, A5E43228900-AA

127

# 6.6 Configuration of the I/O devices

1. Confirm the prompt asking whether the device should be connected redundantly to the PROFINET system with "Yes".
2. Enter a unique device name for the interface module in the properties of the IO device. You can also adapt the automatically assigned IP addresses.

Note

Device names and IP addresses must be unique within a network.

Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)

Configuration Manual, 03/2018, A5E43228900-AA

# 6.6 Configuration of the I/O devices

On the Redundancy tab, check whether the interface modules are connected to the correct PROFINET IO system in each case.

Note

You can find an overview of all the relevant information for realization of PROFINET solutions in SIMATIC PCS 7 in the "PROFINET in Process Automation with SIMATIC PCS 7" (https://support.industry.siemens.com/cs/ww/en/view/72887082) entry.

Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)

Configuration Manual, 03/2018, A5E43228900-AA

129

# Configuration of the hardware (AS and I/O)

# 6.6 Configuration of the I/O devices

# 6.6.3 Symbolic names of inputs and outputs

You can enter symbols directly in HW Config. The screenshot below shows a typical signal list for a chemical plant, as an example.

The symbols are added to the symbol table automatically and can then be used in the CFC.

Note

You can also import the list of hardware signals from an Excel file. This only works directly in the symbol table.

Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)

Configuration Manual, 03/2018, A5E43228900-AA

# 6.6 Configuration of the I/O devices

# 6.6.4 General rules for configuring I/O modules

Introduction

In general, a channel of a module is activated only after connection of the corresponding actuator, sensor or equivalent resistance. Unnecessary diagnostic messages are thus prevented in the PCS 7 OS during runtime.

For some modules, channels are combined into channel groups, e.g. the AI8x12Bit module with 8 channels is composed of 4 channel groups with 2 channels per channel group. In this case, a group is activated as soon as one of the two channels is connected to a signal. At least one equivalent resistance must also be connected in this case.

Analog input (6ES7331-7KF02-0AB0 in the example)

The measuring type depends on whether a transducer which is supplied with power by the module (2-wire transducer) is operated on the AI module, or whether the transducer receives its power from an external supply (4-wire transducer).

The setting of the measuring range module is displayed according to the configuration.
Q: What is the procedure for configuring an ET 200M station as a DP slave according to the 'Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)'?
A1: Open the HW Config catalog (PCS 7 profile) and select the appropriate IM 153-2HF from the PROFIBUS DP/ET 200M folder, then enter the DP address of the PROFIBUS DP slave in the DP slave properties.
A2: To configure an ET 200M station as a DP slave, first access the HW Config catalog under the PCS 7 profile, choose the IM 153-2HF from the PROFIBUS DP/ET 200M folder, and specify the DP address in the DP slave properties.
A3: The configuration involves selecting the IM 153-2HF from the PROFIBUS DP/ET 200M folder in HW Config's PCS 7 profile and setting the DP address in the slave's properties.
A4: Step 1: Navigate to HW Config catalog with PCS 7 profile. Step 2: Pick IM 153-2HF from PROFIBUS DP/ET 200M. Step 3: Input the DP address in the DP slave properties.
A5: Configuring an ET 200M as a DP slave starts with the HW Config catalog in PCS 7 profile, selecting IM 153-2HF from PROFIBUS DP/ET 200M, and defining the DP address in the DP slave properties.

# 6.6 Configuration of the I/O devices

# 6.6.4 General rules for configuring I/O modules

Introduction

In general, a channel of a module is activated only after connection of the corresponding actuator, sensor or equivalent resistance. Unnecessary diagnostic messages are thus prevented in the PCS 7 OS during runtime.

For some modules, channels are combined into channel groups, e.g. the AI8x12Bit module with 8 channels is composed of 4 channel groups with 2 channels per channel group. Analog input (6ES7331-7KF02-0AB0 in the example)

Q: How is high-precision time stamping configured for an ET 200M station in the 'Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)'?
A1: Select the 'Time-of-day synchronization' option in the properties of the ET 200M station and set the synchronization interval to 10.00 s.
A2: For high-precision time stamping, enable 'Time-of-day synchronization' in the ET 200M station's properties and adjust the synchronization interval to 10 seconds.
A3: Configure high-precision time stamping by choosing 'Time-of-day synchronization' in the station properties and setting the interval to 10.00 s.
A4: In the ET 200M station properties, activate 'Time-of-day synchronization' and specify a 10.00 s interval for synchronization.
A5: To achieve high-precision time stamping, the 'Time-of-day synchronization' must be selected in the ET 200M properties with a 10.00 s interval.

# 6.6 Configuration of the I/O devices

# 6.6.4 General rules for configuring I/O modules

Introduction

In general, a channel of a module is activated only after connection of the corresponding actuator, sensor or equivalent resistance. Unnecessary diagnostic messages are thus prevented in the PCS 7 OS during runtime.

For some modules, channels are combined into channel groups, e.g. the AI8x12Bit module with 8 channels is composed of 4 channel groups with 2 channels per channel group. In this case, a group is activated as soon as one of the two channels is connected to a signal. At least one equivalent resistance must also be connected in this case.

Analog input (6ES7331-7KF02-0AB0 in the example)

The measuring type depends on whether a transducer which is supplied with power by the module (2-wire transducer) is operated on the AI module, or whether the transducer receives its power from an external supply (4-wire transducer).

The setting of the measuring range module is displayed according to the configuration.
Q: How is a redundant ET 200SP HA configured on the PROFINET fieldbus as per the 'Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)'?
A1: Open the catalog (PCS 7 profile) in HW Config, select IM 155-6 PN HA Red from the PROFINET IO / I/O / ET 200SP HA folder, and confirm the redundant connection prompt with 'Yes'.
A2: To configure a redundant ET 200SP HA, navigate to HW Config's PCS 7 profile, choose IM 155-6 PN HA Red from the specified folder, and agree to the redundant connection query.
A3: Configuration involves selecting IM 155-6 PN HA Red in HW Config under PCS 7 profile and affirming the redundant connection to PROFINET.
A4: Step 1: Access HW Config's PCS 7 profile. Step 2: Select IM 155-6 PN HA Red. Step 3: Confirm redundant connection with 'Yes'.
A5: For a redundant ET 200SP HA setup, pick IM 155-6 PN HA Red in HW Config's PCS 7 profile and approve the redundant connection prompt.

# 6.6 Configuration of the I/O devices

# 6.6.4 General rules for configuring I/O modules

Introduction

In general, a channel of a module is activated only after connection of the corresponding actuator, sensor or equivalent resistance. Unnecessary diagnostic messages are thus prevented in the PCS 7 OS during runtime.

For some modules, channels are combined into channel groups, e.g. the AI8x12Bit module with 8 channels is composed of 4 channel groups with 2 channels per channel group. In this case, a group is activated as soon as one of the two channels is connected to a signal. At least one equivalent resistance must also be connected in this case.

Analog input (6ES7331-7KF02-0AB0 in the example)

The measuring type depends on whether a transducer which is supplied with power by the module (2-wire transducer) is operated on the AI module, or whether the transducer receives its power from an external supply (4-wire transducer).

The setting of the measuring range module is displayed according to the configuration.
Q: What are the requirements for device names and IP addresses in the configuration of an IO device in the 'Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)'?
A1: Device names and IP addresses must be unique within a network.
A2: Each device name and IP address assigned to an IO device must be unique in its network.
A3: Uniqueness is mandatory for both device names and IP addresses in the network during IO device configuration.
A4: Ensure no duplicates exist for device names and IP addresses within the same network.
A5: The configuration requires that every device name and IP address in the network is distinct.

# Configuration of the hardware (AS and I/O)

# 6.6 Configuration of the I/O devices

# 6.6.1 ET 200M as DP slave (H system and standard AS)

Introduction

The following describes the configuration of an ET 200M station as a typical DP slave.

Note

You can find an exact step-by-step description of the configuration of an ET 200M station in the "SIMATIC Process Control System PCS 7 Engineering System" (https://support.industry.siemens.com/cs/ww/en/view/109746533) manual.

Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)

Configuration Manual, 03/2018, A5E43228900-AA

# 6.6 Configuration of the I/O devices

# Procedure

1. Open the HW Config catalog (PCS 7 profile) and select the appropriate IM 153-2HF from the PROFIBUS DP/ET 200M folder.
2. Enter the DP address of the PROFIBUS DP slave in the DP slave properties. You can also select the subnet for the DP slave (here, PROFIBUS (0)). With an H system, the system automatically establishes the connection to the redundant subnet PROFIBUS (1).

Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)

Configuration Manual, 03/2018, A5E43228900-AA

125

# 6.6 Configuration of the I/O devices

1. For high-precision time stamping, select the "Time-of-day synchronization" option in the properties of the ET 200M station and set the synchronization interval to 10.00 s.
2. The "Replace modules during operation" option must be activated within the operating parameters where the ET 200 station is set up with an active backplane bus. For the connection to a redundant PROFIBUS, this option is preset and is grayed out because the active backplane bus is mandatory in this case.

# 6.6.2 ET 200SP HA as PROFINET device

Introduction

The following describes the configuration of a redundant ET 200SP HA on the PROFINET fieldbus.

Note

You can find an exact step-by-step description of the configuration of an ET 200SP HA station in the "Configuration of the ET 200SP HA in PCS 7 based on different configuration examples" application example.

Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)

Configuration Manual, 03/2018, A5E43228900-AA

# 6.6 Configuration of the I/O devices

# Procedure

1. Open the catalog (PCS 7 profile) in HW Config, and select IM 155-6 PN HA Red from the PROFINET IO / I/O / ET 200SP HA folder.

Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)

Configuration Manual, 03/2018, A5E43228900-AA

127

# 6.6 Configuration of the I/O devices

1. Confirm the prompt asking whether the device should be connected redundantly to the PROFINET system with "Yes".
2. Enter a unique device name for the interface module in the properties of the IO device. You can also adapt the automatically assigned IP addresses.

Note

Device names and IP addresses must be unique within a network.

Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)

Configuration Manual, 03/2018, A5E43228900-AA

# 6.6 Configuration of the I/O devices

On the Redundancy tab, check whether the interface modules are connected to the correct PROFINET IO system in each case.

Note

You can find an overview of all the relevant information for realization of PROFINET solutions in SIMATIC PCS 7 in the "PROFINET in Process Automation with SIMATIC PCS 7" (https://support.industry.siemens.com/cs/ww/en/view/72887082) entry.

Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)

Configuration Manual, 03/2018, A5E43228900-AA

129

# Configuration of the hardware (AS and I/O)

# 6.6 Configuration of the I/O devices

# 6.6.3 Symbolic names of inputs and outputs

You can enter symbols directly in HW Config. The screenshot below shows a typical signal list for a chemical plant, as an example.

The symbols are added to the symbol table automatically and can then be used in the CFC.

Note

You can also import the list of hardware signals from an Excel file. This only works directly in the symbol table.

Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)

Configuration Manual, 03/2018, A5E43228900-AA

# 6.6 Configuration of the I/O devices

# 6.6.4 General rules for configuring I/O modules

Introduction

In general, a channel of a module is activated only after connection of the corresponding actuator, sensor or equivalent resistance. Unnecessary diagnostic messages are thus prevented in the PCS 7 OS during runtime.

For some modules, channels are combined into channel groups, e.g. the AI8x12Bit module with 8 channels is composed of 4 channel groups with 2 channels per channel group. In this case, a group is activated as soon as one of the two channels is connected to a signal. At least one equivalent resistance must also be connected in this case.

Analog input (6ES7331-7KF02-0AB0 in the example)

The measuring type depends on whether a transducer which is supplied with power by the module (2-wire transducer) is operated on the AI module, or whether the transducer receives its power from an external supply (4-wire transducer).

The setting of the measuring range module is displayed according to the configuration.
Q: How can symbolic names of inputs and outputs be entered in HW Config according to the 'Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)'?
A1: Symbols can be entered directly in HW Config and are automatically added to the symbol table for use in the CFC.
A2: Direct entry of symbols in HW Config allows them to be automatically included in the symbol table, ready for CFC use.
A3: Entering symbols directly into HW Config ensures their automatic addition to the symbol table, facilitating CFC utilization.
A4: Symbols inputted in HW Config are seamlessly transferred to the symbol table, enabling their application in CFC.
A5: For CFC use, symbols can be directly input in HW Config, which then auto-populates the symbol table.

NODE_TEXT:
Upper and lower case letters are not a distinguishing feature and are not taken into account when the OS compiled.

Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)

Configuration Manual, 03/2018, A5E43228900-AA

# 6.6 Configuration of the I/O devices

# 6.6.4 General rules for configuring I/O modules

Introduction

In general, a channel of a module is activated only after connection of the corresponding actuator, sensor or equivalent resistance. Unnecessary diagnostic messages are thus prevented in the PCS 7 OS during runtime.

For some modules, channels are combined into channel groups, e.g. the AI8x12Bit module with 8 channels is composed of 4 channel groups with 2 channels per channel group. In this case, a group is activated as soon as one of the two channels is connected to a signal. At least one equivalent resistance must also be connected in this case.

Analog input (6ES7331-7KF02-0AB0 in the example)

The measuring type depends on whether a transducer which is supplied with power by the module (2-wire transducer) is operated on the AI module, or whether the transducer receives its power from an external supply (4-wire transducer).

The setting of the measuring range module is displayed according to the configuration.
Q: What general rule applies to the activation of channels in I/O modules according to the 'Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)'?
A1: A channel is activated only after connection of the corresponding actuator, sensor, or equivalent resistance to prevent unnecessary diagnostic messages.
A2: Activation of a channel occurs post-connection of its respective actuator, sensor, or equivalent resistance, avoiding needless diagnostics.
A3: To avoid superfluous diagnostic messages, channels activate upon connecting the relevant actuator, sensor, or equivalent resistance.
A4: Channels remain inactive until their corresponding actuator, sensor, or equivalent resistance is connected, minimizing diagnostics.
A5: Connection of an actuator, sensor, or equivalent resistance is prerequisite for channel activation to prevent irrelevant diagnostics.

# 6.6 Configuration of the I/O devices

# 6.6.4 General rules for configuring I/O modules

Introduction

In general, a channel of a module is activated only after connection of the corresponding actuator, sensor or equivalent resistance. Unnecessary diagnostic messages are thus prevented in the PCS 7 OS during runtime.

For some modules, channels are combined into channel groups, e.g. the AI8x12Bit module with 8 channels is composed of 4 channel groups with 2 channels per channel group. In this case, a group is activated as soon as one of the two channels is connected to a signal. At least one equivalent resistance must also be connected in this case.

Analog input (6ES7331-7KF02-0AB0 in the example)

The measuring type depends on whether a transducer which is supplied with power by the module (2-wire transducer) is operated on the AI module, or whether the transducer receives its power from an external supply (4-wire transducer).

The setting of the measuring range module is displayed according to the configuration.
Q: How are channel groups in modules like the AI8x12Bit module activated according to the 'Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)'?
A1: A group is activated as soon as one of its channels is connected to a signal, with at least one equivalent resistance also connected.
A2: Activation of a channel group requires connection of at least one channel to a signal and one equivalent resistance.
A3: For channel group activation, connect one channel to a signal and ensure an equivalent resistance is also connected.
A4: Channel groups activate upon signal connection to any channel within the group and connection of an equivalent resistance.
A5: Signal connection to any channel in a group plus equivalent resistance connection triggers group activation.

# 6.6 Configuration of the I/O devices

# 6.6.4 General rules for configuring I/O modules

Introduction

In general, a channel of a module is activated only after connection of the corresponding actuator, sensor or equivalent resistance. Unnecessary diagnostic messages are thus prevented in the PCS 7 OS during runtime.

For some modules, channels are combined into channel groups, e.g. the AI8x12Bit module with 8 channels is composed of 4 channel groups with 2 channels per channel group. In this case, a group is activated as soon as one of the two channels is connected to a signal. At least one equivalent resistance must also be connected in this case.

Analog input (6ES7331-7KF02-0AB0 in the example)

The measuring type depends on whether a transducer which is supplied with power by the module (2-wire transducer) is operated on the AI module, or whether the transducer receives its power from an external supply (4-wire transducer).

The setting of the measuring range module is displayed according to the configuration.
Q: What determines the measuring type for an analog input module as per the 'Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)'?
A1: The measuring type depends on whether the transducer is powered by the module (2-wire transducer) or an external supply (4-wire transducer).
A2: Transducer power source—module (2-wire) or external (4-wire)—determines the analog input module's measuring type.
A3: Measuring type is defined by the transducer's power supply: module-powered for 2-wire, externally powered for 4-wire.
A4: For analog input modules, the measuring type varies based on the transducer being 2-wire (module-powered) or 4-wire (externally powered).
A5: The distinction between 2-wire (module-powered) and 4-wire (externally powered) transducers sets the measuring type for analog inputs.
